    function hideAll(elems) {
      for (var e = 0; e < elems.length; e++) {
        elems[e].style.display = 'none';
      }
    }
    window.onload = function() {
      hideAll(document.querySelectorAll('ol.pre-context'));
      hideAll(document.querySelectorAll('ol.post-context'));
      hideAll(document.querySelectorAll('div.pastebin'));
    }
    function toggle() {
      for (var i = 0; i < arguments.length; i++) {
        var e = document.getElementById(arguments[i]);
        if (e) {
          e.style.display = e.style.display == 'none' ? 'block': 'none';
        }
      }
      return false;
    }
    function switchPastebinFriendly(link) {
      s1 = "Switch to copy-and-paste view";
      s2 = "Switch back to interactive view";
      link.textContent = link.textContent.trim() == s1 ? s2: s1;
      toggle('browserTraceback', 'pastebinTraceback');
      return false;
    }
  </script>

        <li class="frame django">
          
            <code class="fname">C:\Users\20cs0\OneDrive\Desktop\fun\new-backend-using django\myenv\Lib\site-packages\django\utils\decorators.py</code>, line 48, in _wrapper
          

          
            <div class="context" id="c2265860038208">
              
                <ol start="41" class="pre-context" id="pre2265860038208">
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2265860038208', 'post2265860038208')"><pre>        # bound_method has the signature that &#x27;decorator&#x27; expects i.e. no</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2265860038208', 'post2265860038208')"><pre>        # &#x27;self&#x27; argument, but it&#x27;s a closure over self so it can call</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2265860038208', 'post2265860038208')"><pre>        # &#x27;func&#x27;. Also, wrap method.__get__() in a function because new</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2265860038208', 'post2265860038208')"><pre>        # attributes can&#x27;t be set on bound method objects, only on functions.</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2265860038208', 'post2265860038208')"><pre>        bound_method = wraps(method)(partial(method.__get__(self, type(self))))</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2265860038208', 'post2265860038208')"><pre>        for dec in decorators:</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2265860038208', 'post2265860038208')"><pre>            bound_method = dec(bound_method)</pre></li>
                
                </ol>
              
              <ol start="48" class="context-line">
                <li onclick="toggle('pre2265860038208', 'post2265860038208')"><pre>        return bound_method(*args, **kwargs)
                   ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^</pre> <span>…</span></li>
              </ol>
              
                <ol start='49' class="post-context" id="post2265860038208">
                  
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2265860038208', 'post2265860038208')"><pre></pre></li>
                  
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2265860038208', 'post2265860038208')"><pre>    # Copy any attributes that a decorator adds to the function it decorates.</pre></li>
                  
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2265860038208', 'post2265860038208')"><pre>    for dec in decorators:</pre></li>
                  
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2265860038208', 'post2265860038208')"><pre>        _update_method_wrapper(_wrapper, dec)</pre></li>
                  
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2265860038208', 'post2265860038208')"><pre>    # Preserve any existing attributes of &#x27;method&#x27;, including the name.</pre></li>
                  
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2265860038208', 'post2265860038208')"><pre>    update_wrapper(_wrapper, method)</pre></li>
                  
              </ol>
              
            </div>

            <code class="fname">C:\Users\20cs0\OneDrive\Desktop\fun\new-backend-using django\backend\accounts\views.py</code>, line 87, in post
          

          
            <div class="context" id="c2265860258944">
              
                <ol start="80" class="pre-context" id="pre2265860258944">
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2265860258944', 'post2265860258944')"><pre>    def post(self, request):</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2265860258944', 'post2265860258944')"><pre>        serializer = self.serializer_class(data=request.data)</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2265860258944', 'post2265860258944')"><pre></pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2265860258944', 'post2265860258944')"><pre>        if serializer.is_valid():</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2265860258944', 'post2265860258944')"><pre>            email = serializer.data[&#x27;email&#x27;]</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2265860258944', 'post2265860258944')"><pre>            user = User.objects.filter(email=email).first()</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2265860258944', 'post2265860258944')"><pre>            if user:</pre></li>

    function hideAll(elems) {
      for (var e = 0; e < elems.length; e++) {
        elems[e].style.display = 'none';
      }

    window.onload = function() {

    function toggle() {
      for (var i = 0; i < arguments.length; i++) {
        var e = document.getElementById(arguments[i]);
        if (e) {
          e.style.display = e.style.display == 'none' ? 'block': 'none';
        }
      }
      return false;
    }
    function switchPastebinFriendly(link) {
      s1 = "Switch to copy-and-paste view";
      s2 = "Switch back to interactive view";
      link.textContent = link.textContent.trim() == s1 ? s2: s1;
      toggle('browserTraceback', 'pastebinTraceback');
      return false;

                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2265860033472', 'post2265860033472')"><pre>                response = response_for_exception(request, exc)</pre></li>
                  
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2265860033472', 'post2265860033472')"><pre>            return response</pre></li>
                  
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2265860033472', 'post2265860033472')"><pre></pre></li>
                  
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2265860033472', 'post2265860033472')"><pre>        return inner</pre></li>
                  
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2265860033472', 'post2265860033472')"><pre></pre></li>
                  
              </ol>
              
            </div>

            <div class="context" id="c2265860038208">
              
                <ol start="41" class="pre-context" id="pre2265860038208">
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2265860038208', 'post2265860038208')"><pre>        # bound_method has the signature that &#x27;decorator&#x27; expects i.e. no</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2265860038208', 'post2265860038208')"><pre>        # &#x27;self&#x27; argument, but it&#x27;s a closure over self so it can call</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2265860038208', 'post2265860038208')"><pre>        # &#x27;func&#x27;. Also, wrap method.__get__() in a function because new</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2265860038208', 'post2265860038208')"><pre>        # attributes can&#x27;t be set on bound method objects, only on functions.</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2265860038208', 'post2265860038208')"><pre>        bound_method = wraps(method)(partial(method.__get__(self, type(self))))</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2265860038208', 'post2265860038208')"><pre>        for dec in decorators:</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2265860038208', 'post2265860038208')"><pre>            bound_method = dec(bound_method)</pre></li>
                
                </ol>
              
              <ol start="48" class="context-line">
                <li onclick="toggle('pre2265860038208', 'post2265860038208')"><pre>        return bound_method(*args, **kwargs)
                   ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^</pre> <span>…</span></li>
              </ol>

                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2265860038208', 'post2265860038208')"><pre>    for dec in decorators:</pre></li>
                  
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2265860038208', 'post2265860038208')"><pre>        _update_method_wrapper(_wrapper, dec)</pre></li>
                  
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2265860038208', 'post2265860038208')"><pre>    # Preserve any existing attributes of &#x27;method&#x27;, including the name.</pre></li>
                  
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2265860038208', 'post2265860038208')"><pre>    update_wrapper(_wrapper, method)</pre></li>

    function hideAll(elems) {

    function toggle() {
      for (var i = 0; i < arguments.length; i++) {
        var e = document.getElementById(arguments[i]);
        if (e) {
          e.style.display = e.style.display == 'none' ? 'block': 'none';

      }
      return false;

    function switchPastebinFriendly(link) {
      s1 = "Switch to copy-and-paste view";
      s2 = "Switch back to interactive view";
      link.textContent = link.textContent.trim() == s1 ? s2: s1;
      toggle('browserTraceback', 'pastebinTraceback');
      return false;
    }

                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2140494332032', 'post2140494332032')"><pre>        # __name__ and __qualname__ are intentionally left unchanged as</pre></li>
                  
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2140494332032', 'post2140494332032')"><pre>        # view_class should be used to robustly determine the name of the view</pre></li>
                  
              </ol>
              
            </div>

        <li class="frame django">
          
            <code class="fname">C:\Users\20cs0\OneDrive\Desktop\fun\new-backend-using django\myenv\Lib\site-packages\django\utils\decorators.py</code>, line 48, in _wrapper
          

          
            <div class="context" id="c2140493438144">
              
                <ol start="41" class="pre-context" id="pre2140493438144">
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2140493438144', 'post2140493438144')"><pre>        # bound_method has the signature that &#x27;decorator&#x27; expects i.e. no</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2140493438144', 'post2140493438144')"><pre>        # &#x27;self&#x27; argument, but it&#x27;s a closure over self so it can call</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2140493438144', 'post2140493438144')"><pre>        # &#x27;func&#x27;. Also, wrap method.__get__() in a function because new</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2140493438144', 'post2140493438144')"><pre>        # attributes can&#x27;t be set on bound method objects, only on functions.</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2140493438144', 'post2140493438144')"><pre>        bound_method = wraps(method)(partial(method.__get__(self, type(self))))</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2140493438144', 'post2140493438144')"><pre>        for dec in decorators:</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2140493438144', 'post2140493438144')"><pre>            bound_method = dec(bound_method)</pre></li>
                
                </ol>
              
              <ol start="48" class="context-line">
                <li onclick="toggle('pre2140493438144', 'post2140493438144')"><pre>        return bound_method(*args, **kwargs)
                   ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^</pre> <span>…</span></li>
              </ol>
              
                <ol start='49' class="post-context" id="post2140493438144">
                  
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2140493438144', 'post2140493438144')"><pre></pre></li>
                  
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2140493438144', 'post2140493438144')"><pre>    # Copy any attributes that a decorator adds to the function it decorates.</pre></li>
                  
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2140493438144', 'post2140493438144')"><pre>    for dec in decorators:</pre></li>
                  
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2140493438144', 'post2140493438144')"><pre>        _update_method_wrapper(_wrapper, dec)</pre></li>
                  
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2140493438144', 'post2140493438144')"><pre>    # Preserve any existing attributes of &#x27;method&#x27;, including the name.</pre></li>
                  
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2140493438144', 'post2140493438144')"><pre>    update_wrapper(_wrapper, method)</pre></li>
                  
              </ol>
              
            </div>

    function hideAll(elems) {
      for (var e = 0; e < elems.length; e++) {
        elems[e].style.display = 'none';
      }
    }
    window.onload = function() {
      hideAll(document.querySelectorAll('ol.pre-context'));

    function toggle() {
      for (var i = 0; i < arguments.length; i++) {
        var e = document.getElementById(arguments[i]);
        if (e) {
          e.style.display = e.style.display == 'none' ? 'block': 'none';
        }
      }
      return false;
    }
    function switchPastebinFriendly(link) {
      s1 = "Switch to copy-and-paste view";
      s2 = "Switch back to interactive view";
      link.textContent = link.textContent.trim() == s1 ? s2: s1;
      toggle('browserTraceback', 'pastebinTraceback');
      return false;
    }

                <ol start="41" class="pre-context" id="pre2140493438144">
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2140493438144', 'post2140493438144')"><pre>        # bound_method has the signature that &#x27;decorator&#x27; expects i.e. no</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2140493438144', 'post2140493438144')"><pre>        # &#x27;self&#x27; argument, but it&#x27;s a closure over self so it can call</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2140493438144', 'post2140493438144')"><pre>        # &#x27;func&#x27;. Also, wrap method.__get__() in a function because new</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2140493438144', 'post2140493438144')"><pre>        # attributes can&#x27;t be set on bound method objects, only on functions.</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2140493438144', 'post2140493438144')"><pre>        bound_method = wraps(method)(partial(method.__get__(self, type(self))))</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2140493438144', 'post2140493438144')"><pre>        for dec in decorators:</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2140493438144', 'post2140493438144')"><pre>            bound_method = dec(bound_method)</pre></li>
                
                </ol>
              
              <ol start="48" class="context-line">

                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2140493438144', 'post2140493438144')"><pre>        _update_method_wrapper(_wrapper, dec)</pre></li>
                  
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2140493438144', 'post2140493438144')"><pre>    # Preserve any existing attributes of &#x27;method&#x27;, including the name.</pre></li>

    function hideAll(elems) {

        elems[e].style.display = 'none';
      }

    function toggle() {
      for (var i = 0; i < arguments.length; i++) {
        var e = document.getElementById(arguments[i]);
        if (e) {
          e.style.display = e.style.display == 'none' ? 'block': 'none';
        }
      }
      return false;
    }
    function switchPastebinFriendly(link) {
      s1 = "Switch to copy-and-paste view";
      s2 = "Switch back to interactive view";
      link.textContent = link.textContent.trim() == s1 ? s2: s1;
      toggle('browserTraceback', 'pastebinTraceback');
      return false;
    }

                <li onclick="toggle('pre2140494409152', 'post2140494409152')"><pre>            return self.dispatch(request, *args, **kwargs)
                        ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^</pre> <span>…</span></li>
              </ol>
              
                <ol start='105' class="post-context" id="post2140494409152">
                  
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2140494409152', 'post2140494409152')"><pre></pre></li>
                  
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2140494409152', 'post2140494409152')"><pre>        view.view_class = cls</pre></li>
                  
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2140494409152', 'post2140494409152')"><pre>        view.view_initkwargs = initkwargs</pre></li>
                  
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2140494409152', 'post2140494409152')"><pre></pre></li>
                  
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2140494409152', 'post2140494409152')"><pre>        # __name__ and __qualname__ are intentionally left unchanged as</pre></li>
                  
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2140494409152', 'post2140494409152')"><pre>        # view_class should be used to robustly determine the name of the view</pre></li>
                  
              </ol>

            <code class="fname">C:\Users\20cs0\OneDrive\Desktop\fun\new-backend-using django\myenv\Lib\site-packages\django\utils\decorators.py</code>, line 48, in _wrapper
          

          
            <div class="context" id="c2140494411200">
              
                <ol start="41" class="pre-context" id="pre2140494411200">
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2140494411200', 'post2140494411200')"><pre>        # bound_method has the signature that &#x27;decorator&#x27; expects i.e. no</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2140494411200', 'post2140494411200')"><pre>        # &#x27;self&#x27; argument, but it&#x27;s a closure over self so it can call</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2140494411200', 'post2140494411200')"><pre>        # &#x27;func&#x27;. Also, wrap method.__get__() in a function because new</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2140494411200', 'post2140494411200')"><pre>        # attributes can&#x27;t be set on bound method objects, only on functions.</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2140494411200', 'post2140494411200')"><pre>        bound_method = wraps(method)(partial(method.__get__(self, type(self))))</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2140494411200', 'post2140494411200')"><pre>        for dec in decorators:</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2140494411200', 'post2140494411200')"><pre>            bound_method = dec(bound_method)</pre></li>
                
                </ol>
              
              <ol start="48" class="context-line">
                <li onclick="toggle('pre2140494411200', 'post2140494411200')"><pre>        return bound_method(*args, **kwargs)
                   ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^</pre> <span>…</span></li>
              </ol>
              
                <ol start='49' class="post-context" id="post2140494411200">
                  
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2140494411200', 'post2140494411200')"><pre></pre></li>
                  
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2140494411200', 'post2140494411200')"><pre>    # Copy any attributes that a decorator adds to the function it decorates.</pre></li>
                  
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2140494411200', 'post2140494411200')"><pre>    for dec in decorators:</pre></li>
                  
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2140494411200', 'post2140494411200')"><pre>        _update_method_wrapper(_wrapper, dec)</pre></li>
                  
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2140494411200', 'post2140494411200')"><pre>    # Preserve any existing attributes of &#x27;method&#x27;, including the name.</pre></li>
                  
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2140494411200', 'post2140494411200')"><pre>    update_wrapper(_wrapper, method)</pre></li>
                  
              </ol>
              
            </div>

    function hideAll(elems) {
      for (var e = 0; e < elems.length; e++) {
        elems[e].style.display = 'none';
      }
    }
    window.onload = function() {
      hideAll(document.querySelectorAll('ol.pre-context'));
      hideAll(document.querySelectorAll('ol.post-context'));

    }
    function toggle() {
      for (var i = 0; i < arguments.length; i++) {
        var e = document.getElementById(arguments[i]);
        if (e) {
          e.style.display = e.style.display == 'none' ? 'block': 'none';
        }
      }
      return false;
    }
    function switchPastebinFriendly(link) {
      s1 = "Switch to copy-and-paste view";
      s2 = "Switch back to interactive view";
      link.textContent = link.textContent.trim() == s1 ? s2: s1;
      toggle('browserTraceback', 'pastebinTraceback');
      return false;
    }

                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2140494411200', 'post2140494411200')"><pre>        # bound_method has the signature that &#x27;decorator&#x27; expects i.e. no</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2140494411200', 'post2140494411200')"><pre>        # &#x27;self&#x27; argument, but it&#x27;s a closure over self so it can call</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2140494411200', 'post2140494411200')"><pre>        # &#x27;func&#x27;. Also, wrap method.__get__() in a function because new</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2140494411200', 'post2140494411200')"><pre>        # attributes can&#x27;t be set on bound method objects, only on functions.</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2140494411200', 'post2140494411200')"><pre>        bound_method = wraps(method)(partial(method.__get__(self, type(self))))</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2140494411200', 'post2140494411200')"><pre>        for dec in decorators:</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2140494411200', 'post2140494411200')"><pre>            bound_method = dec(bound_method)</pre></li>
                
                </ol>

    function hideAll(elems) {
      for (var e = 0; e < elems.length; e++) {
        elems[e].style.display = 'none';
      }
    }

    function toggle() {
      for (var i = 0; i < arguments.length; i++) {
        var e = document.getElementById(arguments[i]);
        if (e) {
          e.style.display = e.style.display == 'none' ? 'block': 'none';
        }
      }
      return false;

    function switchPastebinFriendly(link) {
      s1 = "Switch to copy-and-paste view";
      s2 = "Switch back to interactive view";
      link.textContent = link.textContent.trim() == s1 ? s2: s1;
      toggle('browserTraceback', 'pastebinTraceback');
      return false;
    }

                        ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^</pre> <span>…</span></li>
              </ol>
              
                <ol start='105' class="post-context" id="post2751452318528">
                  
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2751452318528', 'post2751452318528')"><pre></pre></li>
                  
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2751452318528', 'post2751452318528')"><pre>        view.view_class = cls</pre></li>
                  
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2751452318528', 'post2751452318528')"><pre>        view.view_initkwargs = initkwargs</pre></li>
                  
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2751452318528', 'post2751452318528')"><pre></pre></li>
                  
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2751452318528', 'post2751452318528')"><pre>        # __name__ and __qualname__ are intentionally left unchanged as</pre></li>
                  
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2751452318528', 'post2751452318528')"><pre>        # view_class should be used to robustly determine the name of the view</pre></li>
                  
              </ol>

        <li class="frame django">
          
            <code class="fname">C:\Users\20cs0\OneDrive\Desktop\fun\new-backend-using django\myenv\Lib\site-packages\django\utils\decorators.py</code>, line 48, in _wrapper
          

          
            <div class="context" id="c2751452267456">
              
                <ol start="41" class="pre-context" id="pre2751452267456">
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2751452267456', 'post2751452267456')"><pre>        # bound_method has the signature that &#x27;decorator&#x27; expects i.e. no</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2751452267456', 'post2751452267456')"><pre>        # &#x27;self&#x27; argument, but it&#x27;s a closure over self so it can call</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2751452267456', 'post2751452267456')"><pre>        # &#x27;func&#x27;. Also, wrap method.__get__() in a function because new</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2751452267456', 'post2751452267456')"><pre>        # attributes can&#x27;t be set on bound method objects, only on functions.</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2751452267456', 'post2751452267456')"><pre>        bound_method = wraps(method)(partial(method.__get__(self, type(self))))</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2751452267456', 'post2751452267456')"><pre>        for dec in decorators:</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2751452267456', 'post2751452267456')"><pre>            bound_method = dec(bound_method)</pre></li>
                
                </ol>
              
              <ol start="48" class="context-line">
                <li onclick="toggle('pre2751452267456', 'post2751452267456')"><pre>        return bound_method(*args, **kwargs)
                   ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^</pre> <span>…</span></li>
              </ol>
              
                <ol start='49' class="post-context" id="post2751452267456">
                  
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2751452267456', 'post2751452267456')"><pre></pre></li>
                  
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2751452267456', 'post2751452267456')"><pre>    # Copy any attributes that a decorator adds to the function it decorates.</pre></li>
                  
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2751452267456', 'post2751452267456')"><pre>    for dec in decorators:</pre></li>
                  
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2751452267456', 'post2751452267456')"><pre>        _update_method_wrapper(_wrapper, dec)</pre></li>
                  
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2751452267456', 'post2751452267456')"><pre>    # Preserve any existing attributes of &#x27;method&#x27;, including the name.</pre></li>
                  
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2751452267456', 'post2751452267456')"><pre>    update_wrapper(_wrapper, method)</pre></li>
                  
              </ol>
              
            </div>

    function hideAll(elems) {
      for (var e = 0; e < elems.length; e++) {
        elems[e].style.display = 'none';
      }
    }
    window.onload = function() {
      hideAll(document.querySelectorAll('ol.pre-context'));
      hideAll(document.querySelectorAll('ol.post-context'));

    }
    function toggle() {
      for (var i = 0; i < arguments.length; i++) {
        var e = document.getElementById(arguments[i]);
        if (e) {
          e.style.display = e.style.display == 'none' ? 'block': 'none';
        }
      }
      return false;
    }
    function switchPastebinFriendly(link) {
      s1 = "Switch to copy-and-paste view";
      s2 = "Switch back to interactive view";
      link.textContent = link.textContent.trim() == s1 ? s2: s1;
      toggle('browserTraceback', 'pastebinTraceback');
      return false;
    }

                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2751452267456', 'post2751452267456')"><pre>        # bound_method has the signature that &#x27;decorator&#x27; expects i.e. no</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2751452267456', 'post2751452267456')"><pre>        # &#x27;self&#x27; argument, but it&#x27;s a closure over self so it can call</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2751452267456', 'post2751452267456')"><pre>        # &#x27;func&#x27;. Also, wrap method.__get__() in a function because new</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2751452267456', 'post2751452267456')"><pre>        # attributes can&#x27;t be set on bound method objects, only on functions.</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2751452267456', 'post2751452267456')"><pre>        bound_method = wraps(method)(partial(method.__get__(self, type(self))))</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2751452267456', 'post2751452267456')"><pre>        for dec in decorators:</pre></li>

                </ol>

    function toggle() {
      for (var i = 0; i < arguments.length; i++) {
        var e = document.getElementById(arguments[i]);
        if (e) {
          e.style.display = e.style.display == 'none' ? 'block': 'none';

    function switchPastebinFriendly(link) {
      s1 = "Switch to copy-and-paste view";
      s2 = "Switch back to interactive view";
      link.textContent = link.textContent.trim() == s1 ? s2: s1;
      toggle('browserTraceback', 'pastebinTraceback');
      return false;

                  <li onclick="toggle('pre1905084718400', 'post1905084718400')"><pre>        view.view_class = cls</pre></li>
                  
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre1905084718400', 'post1905084718400')"><pre>        view.view_initkwargs = initkwargs</pre></li>
                  
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre1905084718400', 'post1905084718400')"><pre></pre></li>
                  
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre1905084718400', 'post1905084718400')"><pre>        # __name__ and __qualname__ are intentionally left unchanged as</pre></li>
                  
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre1905084718400', 'post1905084718400')"><pre>        # view_class should be used to robustly determine the name of the view</pre></li>
                  
              </ol>

        <li class="frame django">
          
            <code class="fname">C:\Users\20cs0\OneDrive\Desktop\fun\new-backend-using django\myenv\Lib\site-packages\django\utils\decorators.py</code>, line 48, in _wrapper
          

          
            <div class="context" id="c1905084720704">
              
                <ol start="41" class="pre-context" id="pre1905084720704">
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre1905084720704', 'post1905084720704')"><pre>        # bound_method has the signature that &#x27;decorator&#x27; expects i.e. no</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre1905084720704', 'post1905084720704')"><pre>        # &#x27;self&#x27; argument, but it&#x27;s a closure over self so it can call</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre1905084720704', 'post1905084720704')"><pre>        # &#x27;func&#x27;. Also, wrap method.__get__() in a function because new</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre1905084720704', 'post1905084720704')"><pre>        # attributes can&#x27;t be set on bound method objects, only on functions.</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre1905084720704', 'post1905084720704')"><pre>        bound_method = wraps(method)(partial(method.__get__(self, type(self))))</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre1905084720704', 'post1905084720704')"><pre>        for dec in decorators:</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre1905084720704', 'post1905084720704')"><pre>            bound_method = dec(bound_method)</pre></li>
                
                </ol>
              
              <ol start="48" class="context-line">
                <li onclick="toggle('pre1905084720704', 'post1905084720704')"><pre>        return bound_method(*args, **kwargs)
                   ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^</pre> <span>…</span></li>
              </ol>
              
                <ol start='49' class="post-context" id="post1905084720704">
                  
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre1905084720704', 'post1905084720704')"><pre></pre></li>
                  
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre1905084720704', 'post1905084720704')"><pre>    # Copy any attributes that a decorator adds to the function it decorates.</pre></li>
                  
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre1905084720704', 'post1905084720704')"><pre>    for dec in decorators:</pre></li>
                  
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre1905084720704', 'post1905084720704')"><pre>        _update_method_wrapper(_wrapper, dec)</pre></li>
                  
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre1905084720704', 'post1905084720704')"><pre>    # Preserve any existing attributes of &#x27;method&#x27;, including the name.</pre></li>
                  
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre1905084720704', 'post1905084720704')"><pre>    update_wrapper(_wrapper, method)</pre></li>
                  
              </ol>
              
            </div>

    function hideAll(elems) {
      for (var e = 0; e < elems.length; e++) {
        elems[e].style.display = 'none';
      }
    }
    window.onload = function() {
      hideAll(document.querySelectorAll('ol.pre-context'));

    function toggle() {
      for (var i = 0; i < arguments.length; i++) {
        var e = document.getElementById(arguments[i]);
        if (e) {
          e.style.display = e.style.display == 'none' ? 'block': 'none';
        }
      }
      return false;
    }
    function switchPastebinFriendly(link) {
      s1 = "Switch to copy-and-paste view";
      s2 = "Switch back to interactive view";
      link.textContent = link.textContent.trim() == s1 ? s2: s1;
      toggle('browserTraceback', 'pastebinTraceback');
      return false;
    }

                <ol start="41" class="pre-context" id="pre1905084720704">
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre1905084720704', 'post1905084720704')"><pre>        # bound_method has the signature that &#x27;decorator&#x27; expects i.e. no</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre1905084720704', 'post1905084720704')"><pre>        # &#x27;self&#x27; argument, but it&#x27;s a closure over self so it can call</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre1905084720704', 'post1905084720704')"><pre>        # &#x27;func&#x27;. Also, wrap method.__get__() in a function because new</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre1905084720704', 'post1905084720704')"><pre>        # attributes can&#x27;t be set on bound method objects, only on functions.</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre1905084720704', 'post1905084720704')"><pre>        bound_method = wraps(method)(partial(method.__get__(self, type(self))))</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre1905084720704', 'post1905084720704')"><pre>        for dec in decorators:</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre1905084720704', 'post1905084720704')"><pre>            bound_method = dec(bound_method)</pre></li>
                
                </ol>
              
              <ol start="48" class="context-line">

                  <li onclick="toggle('pre1905084720704', 'post1905084720704')"><pre>    for dec in decorators:</pre></li>
                  
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre1905084720704', 'post1905084720704')"><pre>        _update_method_wrapper(_wrapper, dec)</pre></li>
                  
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre1905084720704', 'post1905084720704')"><pre>    # Preserve any existing attributes of &#x27;method&#x27;, including the name.</pre></li>

    function hideAll(elems) {
      for (var e = 0; e < elems.length; e++) {
        elems[e].style.display = 'none';
      }
    }

    function toggle() {
      for (var i = 0; i < arguments.length; i++) {
        var e = document.getElementById(arguments[i]);
        if (e) {
          e.style.display = e.style.display == 'none' ? 'block': 'none';
        }
      }
      return false;
    }
    function switchPastebinFriendly(link) {
      s1 = "Switch to copy-and-paste view";
      s2 = "Switch back to interactive view";
      link.textContent = link.textContent.trim() == s1 ? s2: s1;
      toggle('browserTraceback', 'pastebinTraceback');
      return false;
    }

                  <li onclick="toggle('pre1537514970176', 'post1537514970176')"><pre>        view.view_class = cls</pre></li>
                  
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre1537514970176', 'post1537514970176')"><pre>        view.view_initkwargs = initkwargs</pre></li>
                  
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre1537514970176', 'post1537514970176')"><pre></pre></li>
                  
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre1537514970176', 'post1537514970176')"><pre>        # __name__ and __qualname__ are intentionally left unchanged as</pre></li>
                  
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre1537514970176', 'post1537514970176')"><pre>        # view_class should be used to robustly determine the name of the view</pre></li>
                  
              </ol>

            <code class="fname">C:\Users\20cs0\OneDrive\Desktop\fun\new-backend-using django\myenv\Lib\site-packages\django\utils\decorators.py</code>, line 48, in _wrapper
          

          
            <div class="context" id="c1537515018368">
              
                <ol start="41" class="pre-context" id="pre1537515018368">
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre1537515018368', 'post1537515018368')"><pre>        # bound_method has the signature that &#x27;decorator&#x27; expects i.e. no</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre1537515018368', 'post1537515018368')"><pre>        # &#x27;self&#x27; argument, but it&#x27;s a closure over self so it can call</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre1537515018368', 'post1537515018368')"><pre>        # &#x27;func&#x27;. Also, wrap method.__get__() in a function because new</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre1537515018368', 'post1537515018368')"><pre>        # attributes can&#x27;t be set on bound method objects, only on functions.</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre1537515018368', 'post1537515018368')"><pre>        bound_method = wraps(method)(partial(method.__get__(self, type(self))))</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre1537515018368', 'post1537515018368')"><pre>        for dec in decorators:</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre1537515018368', 'post1537515018368')"><pre>            bound_method = dec(bound_method)</pre></li>
                
                </ol>
              
              <ol start="48" class="context-line">
                <li onclick="toggle('pre1537515018368', 'post1537515018368')"><pre>        return bound_method(*args, **kwargs)
                   ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^</pre> <span>…</span></li>
              </ol>
              
                <ol start='49' class="post-context" id="post1537515018368">
                  
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre1537515018368', 'post1537515018368')"><pre></pre></li>
                  
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre1537515018368', 'post1537515018368')"><pre>    # Copy any attributes that a decorator adds to the function it decorates.</pre></li>
                  
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre1537515018368', 'post1537515018368')"><pre>    for dec in decorators:</pre></li>
                  
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre1537515018368', 'post1537515018368')"><pre>        _update_method_wrapper(_wrapper, dec)</pre></li>
                  
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre1537515018368', 'post1537515018368')"><pre>    # Preserve any existing attributes of &#x27;method&#x27;, including the name.</pre></li>
                  
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre1537515018368', 'post1537515018368')"><pre>    update_wrapper(_wrapper, method)</pre></li>
                  
              </ol>

        if (e) {

                  <li onclick="toggle('pre1537515018368', 'post1537515018368')"><pre>        # &#x27;self&#x27; argument, but it&#x27;s a closure over self so it can call</pre></li>

    function hideAll(elems) {

      }

    function toggle() {
      for (var i = 0; i < arguments.length; i++) {
        var e = document.getElementById(arguments[i]);
        if (e) {
          e.style.display = e.style.display == 'none' ? 'block': 'none';

      }
      return false;

    function switchPastebinFriendly(link) {
      s1 = "Switch to copy-and-paste view";
      s2 = "Switch back to interactive view";
      link.textContent = link.textContent.trim() == s1 ? s2: s1;
      toggle('browserTraceback', 'pastebinTraceback');
      return false;

                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2326716957376', 'post2326716957376')"><pre>            if not hasattr(self, &quot;request&quot;):</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2326716957376', 'post2326716957376')"><pre>                raise AttributeError(</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2326716957376', 'post2326716957376')"><pre>                    &quot;%s instance has no &#x27;request&#x27; attribute. Did you override &quot;</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2326716957376', 'post2326716957376')"><pre>                    &quot;setup() and forget to call super()?&quot; % cls.__name__</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2326716957376', 'post2326716957376')"><pre>                )</pre></li>
                
                </ol>
              
              <ol start="104" class="context-line">
                <li onclick="toggle('pre2326716957376', 'post2326716957376')"><pre>            return self.dispatch(request, *args, **kwargs)
                        ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^</pre> <span>…</span></li>
              </ol>
              
                <ol start='105' class="post-context" id="post2326716957376">
                  
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2326716957376', 'post2326716957376')"><pre></pre></li>
                  
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2326716957376', 'post2326716957376')"><pre>        view.view_class = cls</pre></li>
                  
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2326716957376', 'post2326716957376')"><pre>        view.view_initkwargs = initkwargs</pre></li>
                  
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2326716957376', 'post2326716957376')"><pre></pre></li>
                  
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2326716957376', 'post2326716957376')"><pre>        # __name__ and __qualname__ are intentionally left unchanged as</pre></li>
                  
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2326716957376', 'post2326716957376')"><pre>        # view_class should be used to robustly determine the name of the view</pre></li>
                  
              </ol>
              
            </div>

            <div class="context" id="c2326738997568">
              
                <ol start="41" class="pre-context" id="pre2326738997568">
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2326738997568', 'post2326738997568')"><pre>        # bound_method has the signature that &#x27;decorator&#x27; expects i.e. no</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2326738997568', 'post2326738997568')"><pre>        # &#x27;self&#x27; argument, but it&#x27;s a closure over self so it can call</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2326738997568', 'post2326738997568')"><pre>        # &#x27;func&#x27;. Also, wrap method.__get__() in a function because new</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2326738997568', 'post2326738997568')"><pre>        # attributes can&#x27;t be set on bound method objects, only on functions.</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2326738997568', 'post2326738997568')"><pre>        bound_method = wraps(method)(partial(method.__get__(self, type(self))))</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2326738997568', 'post2326738997568')"><pre>        for dec in decorators:</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2326738997568', 'post2326738997568')"><pre>            bound_method = dec(bound_method)</pre></li>
                
                </ol>
              
              <ol start="48" class="context-line">
                <li onclick="toggle('pre2326738997568', 'post2326738997568')"><pre>        return bound_method(*args, **kwargs)
                   ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^</pre> <span>…</span></li>
              </ol>

                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2326738997568', 'post2326738997568')"><pre></pre></li>

                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2326738997568', 'post2326738997568')"><pre>    for dec in decorators:</pre></li>
                  
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2326738997568', 'post2326738997568')"><pre>        _update_method_wrapper(_wrapper, dec)</pre></li>
                  
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2326738997568', 'post2326738997568')"><pre>    # Preserve any existing attributes of &#x27;method&#x27;, including the name.</pre></li>
                  
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2326738997568', 'post2326738997568')"><pre>    update_wrapper(_wrapper, method)</pre></li>

    function hideAll(elems) {
      for (var e = 0; e < elems.length; e++) {
        elems[e].style.display = 'none';
      }
    }
    window.onload = function() {

    function toggle() {
      for (var i = 0; i < arguments.length; i++) {
        var e = document.getElementById(arguments[i]);
        if (e) {
          e.style.display = e.style.display == 'none' ? 'block': 'none';
        }
      }
      return false;
    }
    function switchPastebinFriendly(link) {
      s1 = "Switch to copy-and-paste view";
      s2 = "Switch back to interactive view";
      link.textContent = link.textContent.trim() == s1 ? s2: s1;
      toggle('browserTraceback', 'pastebinTraceback');
      return false;

                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2326738997568', 'post2326738997568')"><pre>        # &#x27;self&#x27; argument, but it&#x27;s a closure over self so it can call</pre></li>

                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2326738997568', 'post2326738997568')"><pre>        # attributes can&#x27;t be set on bound method objects, only on functions.</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2326738997568', 'post2326738997568')"><pre>        bound_method = wraps(method)(partial(method.__get__(self, type(self))))</pre></li>

    function toggle() {
      for (var i = 0; i < arguments.length; i++) {
        var e = document.getElementById(arguments[i]);
        if (e) {
          e.style.display = e.style.display == 'none' ? 'block': 'none';

      s2 = "Switch back to interactive view";
      link.textContent = link.textContent.trim() == s1 ? s2: s1;
      toggle('browserTraceback', 'pastebinTraceback');
      return false;

                <ol start="41" class="pre-context" id="pre1879969223360">
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre1879969223360', 'post1879969223360')"><pre>        # bound_method has the signature that &#x27;decorator&#x27; expects i.e. no</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre1879969223360', 'post1879969223360')"><pre>        # &#x27;self&#x27; argument, but it&#x27;s a closure over self so it can call</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre1879969223360', 'post1879969223360')"><pre>        # &#x27;func&#x27;. Also, wrap method.__get__() in a function because new</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre1879969223360', 'post1879969223360')"><pre>        # attributes can&#x27;t be set on bound method objects, only on functions.</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre1879969223360', 'post1879969223360')"><pre>        bound_method = wraps(method)(partial(method.__get__(self, type(self))))</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre1879969223360', 'post1879969223360')"><pre>        for dec in decorators:</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre1879969223360', 'post1879969223360')"><pre>            bound_method = dec(bound_method)</pre></li>
                
                </ol>
              
              <ol start="48" class="context-line">
                <li onclick="toggle('pre1879969223360', 'post1879969223360')"><pre>        return bound_method(*args, **kwargs)
                   ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^</pre> <span>…</span></li>

                  <li onclick="toggle('pre1879969223360', 'post1879969223360')"><pre>    for dec in decorators:</pre></li>
                  
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre1879969223360', 'post1879969223360')"><pre>        _update_method_wrapper(_wrapper, dec)</pre></li>
                  
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre1879969223360', 'post1879969223360')"><pre>    # Preserve any existing attributes of &#x27;method&#x27;, including the name.</pre></li>

    function hideAll(elems) {
      for (var e = 0; e < elems.length; e++) {
        elems[e].style.display = 'none';
      }
    }
    window.onload = function() {
      hideAll(document.querySelectorAll('ol.pre-context'));
      hideAll(document.querySelectorAll('ol.post-context'));
      hideAll(document.querySelectorAll('div.pastebin'));
    }
    function toggle() {
      for (var i = 0; i < arguments.length; i++) {
        var e = document.getElementById(arguments[i]);
        if (e) {
          e.style.display = e.style.display == 'none' ? 'block': 'none';
        }
      }
      return false;
    }
    function switchPastebinFriendly(link) {
      s1 = "Switch to copy-and-paste view";
      s2 = "Switch back to interactive view";
      link.textContent = link.textContent.trim() == s1 ? s2: s1;
      toggle('browserTraceback', 'pastebinTraceback');
      return false;

  <h1>AttributeError
       at /api/request-reset-email/</h1>

                  <li onclick="toggle('pre1879969223360', 'post1879969223360')"><pre>        # bound_method has the signature that &#x27;decorator&#x27; expects i.e. no</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre1879969223360', 'post1879969223360')"><pre>        # &#x27;self&#x27; argument, but it&#x27;s a closure over self so it can call</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre1879969223360', 'post1879969223360')"><pre>        # &#x27;func&#x27;. Also, wrap method.__get__() in a function because new</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre1879969223360', 'post1879969223360')"><pre>        # attributes can&#x27;t be set on bound method objects, only on functions.</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre1879969223360', 'post1879969223360')"><pre>        bound_method = wraps(method)(partial(method.__get__(self, type(self))))</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre1879969223360', 'post1879969223360')"><pre>        for dec in decorators:</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre1879969223360', 'post1879969223360')"><pre>            bound_method = dec(bound_method)</pre></li>
                
                </ol>

    function hideAll(elems) {

    function toggle() {
      for (var i = 0; i < arguments.length; i++) {
        var e = document.getElementById(arguments[i]);
        if (e) {
          e.style.display = e.style.display == 'none' ? 'block': 'none';

      }
      return false;

    function switchPastebinFriendly(link) {
      s1 = "Switch to copy-and-paste view";
      s2 = "Switch back to interactive view";
      link.textContent = link.textContent.trim() == s1 ? s2: s1;
      toggle('browserTraceback', 'pastebinTraceback');
      return false;

            <div class="context" id="c2577942948736">
              
                <ol start="41" class="pre-context" id="pre2577942948736">
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2577942948736', 'post2577942948736')"><pre>        # bound_method has the signature that &#x27;decorator&#x27; expects i.e. no</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2577942948736', 'post2577942948736')"><pre>        # &#x27;self&#x27; argument, but it&#x27;s a closure over self so it can call</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2577942948736', 'post2577942948736')"><pre>        # &#x27;func&#x27;. Also, wrap method.__get__() in a function because new</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2577942948736', 'post2577942948736')"><pre>        # attributes can&#x27;t be set on bound method objects, only on functions.</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2577942948736', 'post2577942948736')"><pre>        bound_method = wraps(method)(partial(method.__get__(self, type(self))))</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2577942948736', 'post2577942948736')"><pre>        for dec in decorators:</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2577942948736', 'post2577942948736')"><pre>            bound_method = dec(bound_method)</pre></li>
                
                </ol>
              
              <ol start="48" class="context-line">
                <li onclick="toggle('pre2577942948736', 'post2577942948736')"><pre>        return bound_method(*args, **kwargs)
                   ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^</pre> <span>…</span></li>
              </ol>
              
                <ol start='49' class="post-context" id="post2577942948736">
                  
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2577942948736', 'post2577942948736')"><pre></pre></li>
                  
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2577942948736', 'post2577942948736')"><pre>    # Copy any attributes that a decorator adds to the function it decorates.</pre></li>
                  
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2577942948736', 'post2577942948736')"><pre>    for dec in decorators:</pre></li>
                  
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2577942948736', 'post2577942948736')"><pre>        _update_method_wrapper(_wrapper, dec)</pre></li>
                  
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2577942948736', 'post2577942948736')"><pre>    # Preserve any existing attributes of &#x27;method&#x27;, including the name.</pre></li>
                  
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2577942948736', 'post2577942948736')"><pre>    update_wrapper(_wrapper, method)</pre></li>

                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2577942952256', 'post2577942952256')"><pre>    # Note: Views are made CSRF exempt from within `as_view` as to prevent</pre></li>
                  
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2577942952256', 'post2577942952256')"><pre>    # accidental removal of this exemption in cases where `dispatch` needs to</pre></li>
                  
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2577942952256', 'post2577942952256')"><pre>    # be overridden.</pre></li>
                  
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2577942952256', 'post2577942952256')"><pre>    def dispatch(self, request, *args, **kwargs):</pre></li>

  <div id="explanation">
    <p>
      You’re seeing this error because you have <code>DEBUG = True</code> in your
      Django settings file. Change that to <code>False</code>, and Django will
      display a standard page generated by the handler for this status code.

    }
    window.onload = function() {
      hideAll(document.querySelectorAll('ol.pre-context'));
      hideAll(document.querySelectorAll('ol.post-context'));
      hideAll(document.querySelectorAll('div.pastebin'));
    }
    function toggle() {
      for (var i = 0; i < arguments.length; i++) {
        var e = document.getElementById(arguments[i]);
        if (e) {
          e.style.display = e.style.display == 'none' ? 'block': 'none';
        }
      }
      return false;
    }
    function switchPastebinFriendly(link) {
      s1 = "Switch to copy-and-paste view";
      s2 = "Switch back to interactive view";
      link.textContent = link.textContent.trim() == s1 ? s2: s1;
      toggle('browserTraceback', 'pastebinTraceback');
      return false;
    }
  </script>
  
</head>

                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2577942948736', 'post2577942948736')"><pre>        # bound_method has the signature that &#x27;decorator&#x27; expects i.e. no</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2577942948736', 'post2577942948736')"><pre>        # &#x27;self&#x27; argument, but it&#x27;s a closure over self so it can call</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2577942948736', 'post2577942948736')"><pre>        # &#x27;func&#x27;. Also, wrap method.__get__() in a function because new</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2577942948736', 'post2577942948736')"><pre>        # attributes can&#x27;t be set on bound method objects, only on functions.</pre></li>
                
                  <li onclick="toggle('pre2577942948736', 'post2577942948736')"><pre>        bound_method = wraps(method)(partial(method.__get__(self, type(self))))</pre></li>

                </ol>

</div>

  <div id="explanation">
    <p>
      You’re seeing this error because you have <code>DEBUG = True</code> in your
      Django settings file. Change that to <code>False</code>, and Django will
      display a standard page generated by the handler for this status code.
    </p>
  </div>

</body>
</html>
